snippet: Thousands gathered in dozens of cities on Saturday to mourn the unarmed black teenager shot to death early last year, and to add their voices to a debate on race that his death has set off.
abstract: Thousands of demonstrators gather in dozens of cities to commemorate Trayvon Martin, unarmed black teenager shot to death in a confrontation with neighborhood watch volunteer George Zimmerman, and to add their voices to a debate on race that his death has set off.

byline.original: By CHANNING JOSEPH and RAVI SOMAIYA
byline.contributor: Channing Joseph and Ravi Somaiya reported from New York. Reporting was contributed by Emily Schmall from Miami, Alan Blinder from Atlanta, Mona El-Naggar from New York and Ana Facio-Krajcer from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Thousands gathered in dozens of cities on Saturday to mourn the unarmed black teenager shot to death early last year, and to add their voices to a debate on race that his death has set off.

headline.main: Demonstrations Across the Country Commemorate  Trayvon Martin
headline.print_headline: Demonstrations Commemorate Teenager Killed in Florida
